thread.title: X Factor contestant Mason Noise stages dramatic stage walk-off during the Six Chair Challenge - The X Factor Reality TV
thread.title_full: X Factor contestant Mason Noise stages dramatic stage walk-off during the Six Chair Challenge - The X Factor News - Reality TV - Digital Spy

author: Susannah Alexander
title: X Factor contestant Mason Noise stages dramatic stage walk-off during the Six Chair Challenge - The X Factor Reality TV
text: As if The X Factor's Six Chair Challenge wasn't dramatic enough, tonight's show saw one contestant throw his mic to the ground and storm off the stage.Mason Noise, who was battling for a place in Nick Grimshaw's Boys Category, started his audition promisingly, as his The Weeknd, Blackstreet and Justin Timberlake mash-up impressed both the judges and the audience.The X Factor 2015: Sunday's Six Chair Challenge video round up - Relive the boys' auditionsHowever things soon took a turn as Noise accused Simon Cowell of allowing some contestants to have longer audition slots than others on the TV broadcast - and invited the audience to film what he was about to say.Cowell didn't take this too well, saying: "What gives you the right to say that? You're talking to me, not to them.""Alright, I'll tell it straight," Noise countered. "The first audition I watched on Saturday, people had 10 minute slots. And I went to 47 seconds."Cowell then told Noise that he was "five seconds from being thrown off this stage" before adding: "If you've got a problem just go." © ITV / Thames/Syco/Fremantle Media But Noise wasn't giving up easily, telling the crowd: "I'm doing this for you. I'm doing this for entertainment. I'm doing this for artists. This is real."The whole thing soon turned into a pretty serious argument, with Cowell telling Noise to "shut up" and accusing him of insulting the producers who spent hours editing his tape.In the end it all got too much for Noise, who simply threw his mic to the ground and marched off the stage, much to the shock of his fellow contestants and the crowd. © ITV / Thames/Syco/Fremantle Media While Rita Ora labelled his outburst "the Kanye West effect", a disappointed Nick Grimshaw said "he would have had a chair".But Noise didn't seem too bothered by his failure to win a chair, simply saying: "I've done what I need to do."The X Factor returns next Sunday (October 18) at 7pm on ITV. Want to be on The X Factor, but without Simon Cowell grimacing at you?
